questions.question: She always …………………. to her elder sister.
questions.description: To defer is to give in to someone

questions.question: May I return this toaster if it is .....................…?
questions.description: If something is defective, it is faulty.

questions.question: The policeman’s badge ...................... the bullet.
questions.description: To deflect is to prevent something undesirable from being aimed at you.

questions.question: His treatment of the elderly people was affectionate and .....................
She has a ..................... that makes walking difficult.
After all those expenses, we ended the year with a ......................
questions.description: Deficit means an excess of money spent over money earned.

questions.question: The company has been ..................... since the war.
questions.description: If something is defunct it is no longer functioning.

questions.question: He ………………… the book by writing on it.
questions.description: To deface is to spoil the appearance of something.

questions.question: The child showed ..................... by refusing to eat.
questions.description: Defiance means open refusal to obey.

questions.question: From her conversation, I ...................... that she had a large family.
questions.description: To deduce is to form an opinion or conclusion.

questions.question: I ………………… it advisable to buy property now.
questions.description: To deem is to consider something in a particular way.

questions.question: Jennifer always acts with ......................
questions.description: Decorum means polite and socially acceptable behavior.
